whiteList.description: Does the substrate have a release liner (often called backing sheet).

attributeValues.description: Glassine is a smooth and glossy paper that is air, water and grease resistant. It is usually available in densities between 50–90 g/m2.

whiteList.description: Describes the material used for the Release Liner.Often called a "Backing Sheet".
Measured in Microns.
The width of the final product in cm. This would be the sheet size on which multiple labels or decals would be presented to the customer. E.g. A4 sheet with 10 labels attached.
The height of the final product in cm. This would be the sheet size on which multiple labels or decals would be presented to the customer. E.g. A4 sheet with 10 labels attached.
The type of printing process and ink used to print on the substrate (e.g. Aqueous versus Solvent).

This is to tell that there are pre-designed pattern for a specific product to select from. If this is answered as Yes, then the user could create tenant definition with whatever the graphic design ID/text available to configure the product.

attributeValues.description: CMYK with light Cyan and light Magenta, specifically used with Large Format Inkjet plotters, colors are chosen by the RIP (Raster Image Processor), Benefit: better quality of image reproduction in pastel colors.

whiteList.description: Indicates the type and number of process colors used to print on the substrate (including none, if side 1 of the substrate is left blank).

The number of spot colors used to print on side 1 of the substrate (not including any of the process colors that are specified in the Process Colors Side 1 attribute).  One example would be indicating 1 spot color if a white layer is used in addition to process colors.

The type of print coating to be applied to side 1 of the product.  One example would be a type of coating intended to add protection to the printed product or to provide a specific visual effect, such as gloss finish.
The intended visual finish resulting from the application of a print coating to side 1 of a product.
Description of a specific feature associated with a coating being applied to side 1 of a product.  An example would be that the lamination is scratch-resistant.
The intended visual effect due to application of a lamination.

attributeValues.description: An adhesive that is meant for a single application with no intention of removal.

whiteList.description: Describes the Type of Adhesive used on the substrate. Adhesives may be broadly divided in two classes: structural and pressure-sensitive.

The specific type of packaging to be applied directly to the product.  This is not shipping packaging, but would be the inside packaging that can impact a customers' perception of the product.  One example would be the use of shrinkwrap on a stack of postcards vs. using a band to hold the cards together.

The type of packaging within which the product is shipped.  This can be specific to one unit of a product or multiple units.  One example would be a product that ships in a specific box to ensure product safety in transit.
The material can be used for outdoor applications.
The material is made out of a material that is very difficult to rip / tear.
The material is made out of a material / has a coating which makes the material resistant to flames.
Material is resistant to water.
Material has properties that make it resistant to scratches.
Has properties for Graffiti resistance.
Product has Privacy features built in. This can be one way material or similar.
Roll Core Diameter in cm
Defines the Max Outside Diameter possible of the full roll when wound with labels.

attributeValues.description: Label surface is wound internally on the roll.

whiteList.description: The direction the labels are wound onto the Core.
Determines how much surface bleed is on the product.
Defines the quantity of the order.

Time from when an order is received to when the product is manufacturing complete.  This attribute should be correlated with Production Time Type, which will allow you to indicate whether you manage this time in hh (hours) or dd (days).  
Example: Enter your value/s as a number within Production Time and your unit of measure within Production Time Type attribute.

The Production Time Type should be correlated with the Production Time attribute.  Production Time Type allows you to indicate if the production time for your fulfillment location should be managed in hh (hours) or in dd (days).
The quantity of this item that are combined in a single shippable pack. The number of shippable packs will be determined by dividing the ordered quantity by the Shippable Pack Quantity.
he weight of a single shippable pack in grams [g].
The first dimension of a single shippable pack in centimeters [cm].
The second dimension of a single shippable pack in centimeters [cm].
Third dimension of a single shippable pack in centimeters [cm].

attributeValues.description: Otherwise known as top of text first. Leading edge is the top of the image.
Otherwise known as Left side of text first. Leading edge is Left hand edge of Image.
Otherwise known as Bottom edge first. Leading edge is the bottom of image.
Right hand edge first. Leading edge is the right hand side of the image.

whiteList.description: Defines the direction in which the Image is positioned on the reel relative to the out put direction.
Describes the gap between each label on a roll in mm. Required for unwinding process machinery.
Height of the roll. Is not a number cause is to think about it as a Model (small, medium, ...)
The width of the product in cm after it has been printed and cut down to its desired width from a larger sheet,an individual Sticker or Decal.
Describes the amount of labels on each roll. There can be multiple rolls on an order.
The height of the product in cm after it has been printed and cut down to its desired width from a larger sheet,an individual Sticker or Decal.
Specify whether a MCP SKU is only used for routing purposes at the order level.
